column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=IV
#Text=6.45 P. M. No , it is useless .
#Text=There is no human help for me ;
#Text=I must fight this out single-handed .
#Text=Two courses lie before me .
#Text=I might become this woman 's lover .
#Text=Or I must endure such persecutions as she can inflict upon me .
#Text=Even if none come , I shall live in a hell of apprehension .
#Text=But she may torture me , she may drive me mad , she may kill me : I will never , never , never give in .
#Text=What can she inflict which would be worse than the loss of Agatha , and the knowledge that I am a perjured liar , and have forfeited the name of gentleman ?
#Text=Pratt-Haldane was most amiable , and listened with all politeness to my story .
#Text=But when I looked at his heavy set features , his slow eyes , and the ponderous study furniture which surrounded him , I could hardly tell him what I had come to say .
#Text=It was all so substantial , so material .
#Text=And , besides , what would I myself have said a short month ago if one of my colleagues had come to me with a story of demonic possession ? Perhaps .
#Text=I should have been less patient than he was .

#Text=As it was , he took notes of my statement , asked me how much tea I drank , how many hours I slept , whether I had been overworking much , had I had sudden pains in the head , evil dreams , singing in the ears , flashes before the eyes -- all questions which pointed to his belief that brain congestion was at the bottom of my trouble .
#Text=Finally he dismissed me with a great many platitudes about open-air exercise , and avoidance of nervous excitement .
#Text=His prescription , which was for chloral and bromide , I rolled up and threw into the gutter .
#Text=No , I can look for no help from any human being .
#Text=If I consult any more , they may put their heads together and I may find myself in an asylum .
#Text=I can but grip my courage with both hands , and pray that an honest man may not be abandoned .
#Text=April 10 .
#Text=It is the sweetest spring within the memory of man .
#Text=So green , so mild , so beautiful !
#Text=Ah , what a contrast between nature without and my own soul so torn with doubt and terror !
#Text=It has been an uneventful day , but I know that I am on the edge of an abyss .
#Text=I know it , and yet I go on with the routine of my life .
#Text=The one bright spot is that Agatha is happy and well and out of all danger .
#Text=If this creature had a hand on each of us , what might she not do ?
#Text=April 16 .
#Text=The woman is ingenious in her torments .
#Text=She knows how fond I am of my work , and how highly my lectures are thought of .
#Text=So it is from that point that she now attacks me .
#Text=It will end , I can see , in my losing my professorship , but I will fight to the finish .
#Text=She shall not drive me out of it without a struggle .
#Text=I was not conscious of any change during my lecture this morning save that for a minute or two I had a dizziness and swimminess which rapidly passed away .
#Text=On the contrary , I congratulated myself upon having made my subject ( the functions of the red corpuscles ) both interesting and clear .

#Text=I was surprised , therefore , when a student came into my laboratory immediately after the lecture , and complained of being puzzled by the discrepancy between my statements and those in the text books .
#Text=He showed me his note-book , in which I was reported as having in one portion of the lecture championed the most outrageous and unscientific heresies .

#Text=Of course I denied it , and declared that he had misunderstood me , but on comparing his notes with those of his companions , it became clear that he was right , and that I really had made some most preposterous statements .
#Text=Of course I shall explain it away as being the result of a moment of aberration , but I feel only too sure that it will be the first of a series .
#Text=It is but a month now to the end of the session , and I pray that I may be able to hold out until then .
#Text=April 26 .
#Text=Ten days have elapsed since I have had the heart to make any entry in my journal .
#Text=Why should I record my own humiliation and degradation ? I had vowed never to open it again .

#Text=And yet the force of habit is strong , and here I find myself taking up once more the record of my own dreadful experiences -- in much the same spirit in which a suicide has been known to take notes of the effects of the poison which killed him .
#Text=Well , the crash which I had foreseen has come -- and that no further back than yesterday .
#Text=The university authorities have taken my lectureship from me .
#Text=It has been done in the most delicate way , purporting to be a temporary measure to relieve me from the effects of overwork , and to give me the opportunity of recovering my health .
#Text=None the less , it has been done , and I am no longer Professor Gilroy .
#Text=The laboratory is still in my charge , but I have little doubt that that also will soon go .
